# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#Load R libraries
library(opalr)
library(tidyverse)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()

#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the GLOBE table(s) to your RStudio environment
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_0 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0')


opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_1 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1')


opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_2 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_3 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3')

opal.logout(erasmus_opal)

```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
lsb_ROTTERDAM_0 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_0$id)
lsb_ROTTERDAM_1 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_1$id)
lsb_ROTTERDAM_2 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_2$id)
lsb_ROTTERDAM_3 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_3$id)

```

### **Variable label**:  Current consumption of alcohol  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_cur_0  
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant currently consumes alcohol or has consumed alcohol in the past 12 months.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |  Does not currently consume alcohol   
1 |  Currently consumes alcohol  

 **Harmonization status**:  complete      
**Harmonization comment**:   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3, 	ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3b!=888, useNA="always")

table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3, 	ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3a, useNA="always")

lsb_ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_alc_cur_0<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3==0, 0L, ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3==1, 1L, NA))
table(lsb_ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_alc_cur_0, useNA="always")

```

------------- | -------------

 **Harmonization status**:  complete     
**Harmonization comment**:   The study-specific variable is "How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion?". The study specific category "weekly 1 to 3 times per week" is coded under category 2| 1 to 2 times a week, of the harmonized variable; while the study-specific category "daily or almost daily 4 or more times per week" is coded under category 3 |  3 times a week or more.  

**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

#??

table(ROTTERDAM_3$e6_EIAUDIT3)

lsb_ROTTERDAM_3$lsb_alc_binge_3<- recode(as.character(ROTTERDAM_3$e6_EIAUDIT3), "0"=1L, "1"=1L, "2"=1L, "3"=2L, "4"=3L,
                                         .default =NA_integer_)

# 0 = 'never'
# 1 = 'less than monthly'
# 2 = 'monthly 1to 3 times per month'
# 3 = 'weekly 1to 3 times per week'
# 4 = 'daily or almost daily 4 or more times per week'
# 7 = 'dont know'
# 9 = 'missing '

table(lsb_ROTTERDAM_3$lsb_alc_binge_3)
```

### **Variable label**:   Current quantity of alcohol consumed per week (total)  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_total_1  
**Variable description**:  Current quantity of wine, beer and liquor consumed per week.    
**Value type**: decimal    
**Variable unit**: drinks/week  
**Category coding**:  N/A  

**Harmonization status**:        
**Harmonization comment**:   The study specific variable is: How many glasses of alcoholic beverages do you drink per week?  


**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

ROTTERDAM_1$nb_beer     <-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didbe==1, ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didbefr, ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didbe==0, 0L, NA))
ROTTERDAM_1$nb_whitewine<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didwwi==1, ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didwwifr, ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didwwi==0, 0L, NA))
ROTTERDAM_1$nb_redwine  <-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didrwi==1, ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didrwifr, ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didrwi==0, 0L, NA))
ROTTERDAM_1$nb_modstrong<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didsh==1, ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didshfr, ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didsh==0, 0L, NA))
ROTTERDAM_1$nb_liq      <-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didli==1, ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didlifr, ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didli==0, 0L, NA))
  
table(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didwwifr)
ROTTERDAM_1[,289:293]
lsb_ROTTERDAM_1$lsb_alc_total_1 <- rowSums(ROTTERDAM_1[,289:293])
```  
